Column Comment.0: FOSSIL IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for a fossil.
Column Comment.1: FOSSIL DESCRIPTION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for the fossil description
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: Text description of the fossil.
Column Comment.5: FOSSIL DESCRIPTION CODE: A list of valid code values for each type of fossildescription type. Note the two part primary key allows each description type to haveits own specific lists of code values.
Column Comment.6: FOSSIL DESCRIPTION TYPE: A list of valid description types for fossils. Mayinclude descriptors such as color, size, spines, shape, composition etc.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.9: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum value for this description, usually used for a rangeof values. If the value is single, use MAXIMUM VALUE or copy the same value intoboth MIN and MAX columns.
Column Comment.11: MINIMUM VALUE: the minimum value for this description, usually used for a range ofvalues. If the value is single, use MAXIMUM VALUE or copy the same value into bothcolumns.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE DOCUMENT: reference to the document in which the description wasoriginally published.
Column Comment.17: VALUE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: for both MIN and MAX VALUE.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
